This chapter is a simple example using R

You can import R package using the code

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(FactoMineR)
library(dplyr)
```


and then describe the purpose of your chapter as well as executing R command.


For example a basic summary of a dataset is given by 

```{r}
df <- read.table("pollen.csv", sep = ";" , header = TRUE)
```

and produce a graph

```{r}
df %>% ggplot() +
	aes(x=species, y = body_mass_g) +
	geom_boxplot()  
```

EFFET DU PÂTURAGE SUR LES STRATÉGIES DE POLLINISATION


```{r}
# Boxplot 
par(mfrow=c(1,2))
boxplot(df$RatioPoll~df$treatment, varwidth = TRUE, ylab = "Ratio Pollinisation", xlab = "treatment", col='blue', main = "")

```
```{r}
# Anova
hyp1<-lm(RatioPoll~1,data=df)
hyp2<-lm(RatioPoll~treatment,data=df)
anova(hyp1,hyp2)
```
